website_summaries.verdict: Plastic rack fits well in tight spaces and effectively organizes cans by expiration date.
pros: Stores up to 54 cans between 4 and 15 ounces
First in, first out design keeps cans in order of expiration date
Racks can be easily stacked on top of each other
cons: Cans from middle row must be manually rotated to the bottom

customer_reviews.title: Great for visibly, accessibility and organization
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! Works GREAT for condensed soup cans, veggie cans, mini mushroom cans and mini juice cans. Holds 14 veggie cans per section. Comes with different sized pegs for adjustable storage. Can add on multiple units. 16.25" W X 16" D X 12" H. NOT for soda cans or large soup cans.
customer_reviews.author: Saritah

customer_reviews.title: Great unit!
customer_reviews.text: While there are positive reviews there's a few negative so I was skeptical. I purchased one unit and tried it out for about a month before I bought the second. If you're looking for a great way to store canned food this is it! One unit holds three rows of 14 cans two units connected holds 7 rows of cans for a total of 98 cans. I will be buying two more. Recommend to assemble two or more units before you put cans in them :-). keep the extra pieces because if you need them in the future they are a bit pricey off the website. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Nice pantry can storage, but not true FIFO
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews state the system is not a true FIFO due to the middle row not being able to roll out until all the cans on the top row are gone. It does store a lot of cans which is nice. It was easy to assemble. It doesn't do well to hold small cans of things like Tuna. It can hold a few large 28 oz type cans like Libby's large cans of pumpkin, but they won't roll for the top or middle shelves as the bars that connect the sides prevent it, but you can insert a few of them from the bottom and push them up.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect cans to roll to you
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this can have so many great reviews... something's fishy, because this is a real PoS. This thing is difficult to put together, and actually not that space efficient. Worst of all, you put the cans in there and they don't really roll, unless there are many other cans/weight behind it. They easily flip around and fall off track. Just a real lousy piece of engineering altogether. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Henry

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this but I did not. It was hard to assemble once I would take a can out one of pieces holding the unit together would come apart. Awful if I hadn’t gotten rid of the box I would have returned it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fit large Veg-All, Family-size Campbell’s soup or Campbell’s Chunky soup cans
customer_reviews.text: Will not fit larger diameter and length cans, such as large Veg-All, Family-size Campbell’s soup and Campbell’s Chunky Soup cans. I am returning and getting one that does not rotate and has more room for the larger cans we use frequently. This is a great product if you just want to use it with regular sized cans. When assembling, go ahead and take their advise and use pliers- makes putting together quick and easy. Lower scores are simply because it didn’t fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: KayBee

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: This storage rack was a big design fail. Most of the cans we tried didn't fit or they fit in the top but we couldn't get them out at the bottom. The plastic molded edges were also very sharp and tore up my knuckle when I reached for a can. Good in theory, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: jrubin

customer_reviews.title: Not all cans fit
customer_reviews.text: I want to start first by saying that the quality is good. Pretty easy to assemble and a good size. The problem is that you have to have the perfect can to fit in the rack. The pictured Del Monte or a standard Campbell's can would work well. I have Chunky and Progresso soups and they don't. There is no flexibility with this system. I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary quality, super easy to build, and easily fits in standard shelf space.
customer_reviews.text: These can dispensers are the best! Perfect shelf size for the average pantry. I can’t say enough about them. Made to last. Heavy duty. Easy to assemble.(however I recommend a set of pliers to keep handy because turning the locking pieces can be tough on the hands) I wish that I had these years ago. Saving to order more because these are great for organizing my canned goods. Everyone should have at least one. Great house warming gift or gift for a home with a new baby. (More mouths, more food)we are a family of six and when they start moving out I will send a set with them. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great organizing tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this organizer! It was easy to put together, and you can decide whether you want 3 equal sized openings, or if you'd rather have one smaller opening. I also like that I can add a 2nd set on and extend it into 6 openings. I plan to order another one to make it 6 wide. My pantry is so much better with this organizer! My cans aren't falling out anymore onto bare toes or curious puppy noses. I wish I had bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: B.girl

customer_reviews.title: I wished for 9 storage spots but it was 3 large spots... My bad
customer_reviews.text: They are great if you only want to hold 3 types of canned goods in great amounts. I messed up and didn't realize that each slot dropped to the bottom... I thought it stored 9 different types of canned goods. Well... I made it work by adding cardboard cut outs to slip all the way to the back so I can have 9 different spots. I did not feel like disassembling it and returning it. It's great if you are using it for a store or something... Or get many add ons for an apocalypse. It seems to store about 15 cans in each column... And has 3 columns.
customer_reviews.author: Gena woods

customer_reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to be!
customer_reviews.text: They will not hold Progresso or Campbell's soup unless it's the condensed ones. I'm very disappointed that the Progresso soup won't fit. When it says it's adjustable means they send one set of pegs that will make one section smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Julie's hunny

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great setup to store some bulk cans. It’s very sturdy, it goes together pretty easy, and it holds the cans and distributes them nicely. I like that it comes with the option to add on a rack for smaller cans but it doesn’t come with the stuff to do so. My only other complaint is that it’s pretty expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: circle_of_iron

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one a year or 2 ago and liked it so much that I bought another to finish my cabinet! Had to find a different storage rack for the bottom shelf because this one didn't fit and it's not as nice and doesn't hold as much as this one. They've held up nicely
customer_reviews.author: Gena

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It's quite big overall because the plastic shelving takes up a lot of space but the organization of the cans makes it that the whole thing, shelves and cans together, takes up less space than when the cans were haphazardly stored on top of one another. In addition, it's allowed me to reorganize the cans by types of foods (soups, fruit cans, beans, tuna, etc.) and bring the cans with the earliest expiration dates in front. Because of Covid, we have more cans stored than normal so this gizmo will allow us to use them and replace them so that less food is thrown out.
customer_reviews.author: Viviane Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold fatter cans.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea but didn't fit my needs. It doesn't rotate very well since it a 3 tier. The middle row empties out after the top row. You load on the top row and pull from the bottom. If you add more to the top row before emptying the middle row then your cans in the middle row don't get rotated. I was planning on using this product for storing and rotating my soup cans but some of them were to fat and would get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bates

customer_reviews.title: Versatile configuration that works well
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact that you can customize to fit various can sizes to a degree. The units assembled easily enough but did require a little bit of a learning curve. Having said that, it was no more than I expected and the instructions were clear to me. I'm very happy with the way these units work, and they have made our pantry much more organized.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Ladd

customer_reviews.title: So much easier to inventory
customer_reviews.text: This picture show 2 FIFO units. I bought one initially and like it so much that I bought the second one. Then realized I could attach them to each other. Quite sturdy and not too hard to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: storage and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This item is great if you are tired of pulling cans upon cans to find what you need. Just pull and refeed into the system till you find your specific can. I organized ours into lanes, canned veggies, fruit, beans, tomato sauce, soups etc. I have more space for other items now, boxed and bagged. Putting it together was a bit tough though. You need small hands or a pair of plyers to turn the locking mechanism to connect each piece, but it's worth it. You'll be happy that you got it.
customer_reviews.author: DJM57

customer_reviews.title: Organizational Dream
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife to help her keep organized. I put them together for her and fell in love with them. They are the best thing I can see for organizing your cans, and ensuring that there isn’t an expired can sitting in the back of your pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Angie F.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Not the same item as pictured. The item shipped only holds 30 normal sized cans and 10 tuna sized cans. It was advertised 54 and the box I received advertised 40 cans and is by a different brand. Pretty disappointed. Other options for holding this number of cans for less money. Not very sturdy either.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product with some minor drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: holds a good number of cans; the units are "stackable" meaning that two can attach with an extra row in between; loading and dispensing 15oz cans is great, very convenient; Cons: side panels flex a bit more than I'd like; unit has cut-outs with corners that flex, sometimes hanging up a can; the top feed ramp will accept 20oz. cans that will not feed out the bottom; The cons are not deal killers, by any means, but enough of an annoyance for me to give it 4 stars instead of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Strong and made to last. Holds alot of cans. Had extra pieces. Had to have my husband help put it together. Pieces fit snuggly and securly. Used pliers luke instructions suggested and it helped. Did not break useing pliers. Just purchased a second one. Only rated it 4 of 5 stars on assembly because of strength needed to asemble.
customer_reviews.author: Raina Jipson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love that it rotates my cans. I wish it allowed for the fatter cans like the big progresso soup cans. I bought two and love them. They are sturdy enough to place a basket on top of to maximize my food storage and organization
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: See details
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to use and keep together. Too bulky in cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. Definitely makes rotating my inventory easier. Easy to assemble, sturdy plastic. Like that I can attach additional units to this. Will be being at least one additional unit.
customer_reviews.author: saundra marshall

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t really hold big cans
customer_reviews.text: This is far too awkward to fit in any kitchen shelf or cabinet and had to be relegated to a garage shelf. Making it awkward. It doesn’t really hold anything big, like a progreso can. Just my normal cans lots of them. But no where near the quoted number.
customer_reviews.author: CSSTS

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Saves space in my pantry, and the cans that fit, it's nice to have them drop down in the order I put them in. Some cans are just a 'hair' too big and so they don't drop down at all. Overall, ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: Hantie

customer_reviews.title: Great can veggies holder
customer_reviews.text: Works great for organizing your pantry. I put different can goods in each area. Love that now I can see what I have, in fact I order the next one down because the larger ones were gone.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bough

customer_reviews.title: Middle row is worthless
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully you read these reviews before you buy, it works well enough but the middle row doesn't rotate at all until the entire top row is gone. So if you want FIFO you just have to not use that row. Other then that it works pretty well, it doesn't hold cans of spaghettio's though which is odd since they are 15 oz cans.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Mackay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, a solution to the problem
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and it came with some extra rods so that it can hold smaller cans. It doesnt hold the extra large cans. You can also add on more sides if you buy multiple kits. Only downfall is that you cannot use the second row really well. One row must empty before the second one feeds. They are also not stackable.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: wish I measured
customer_reviews.text: I didn't measure my pantry and it doesn't fit very well. On top of that, you can only have three different times of cans, because it holds a lot, but only three different times.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Stone

customer_reviews.title: Nice to see the cans roll in front
customer_reviews.text: I like this because it holds up to 54 cans. Problem is the larger so UK p cans like Campbell's soups and progresso it will not hold. I'm not nuts about the quality of this item but for now it serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn R.

customer_reviews.title: Check the sizes
customer_reviews.text: Like the design and fifo concept for most 10 oz cans. Don't like that 18 oz. Progresso cans won't feed to the bottom tray due to posts on that shelf blocking the cans. I guess I'll have to do a "Goldberg" workaround. If anyone can suggest a solution, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: cautious 1

customer_reviews.title: I like these a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot. I don't know if they actually gave me more space but they definitely let me see what I have much better. I placed 2 of these side by side on my pantry shelf and the 2 easily connected to make another row between them. This was extremely easy to put together, no tools needed. I thought the price was a little high but once you buy them you have them forever, they're not flimsy at all. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brawn, not beauty
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very sturdy and does exactly what it was designed to do only drawback is that it's huge--much deeper than I imagined (my fault, not the product's). I'm going to have to do some rearranging so I can fit it in my below-counter cupboards. It could stay on my counter but it's not exactly designed for aesthetic appeal. All function, no form. Another plus: it's SUPER easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Liz S.

customer_reviews.title: Arived with some damage, but works good
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of the 4 main pieces arrived with damage. Once piece was damaged in a non functional area and the other I used epoxy. Box had no damage so I feel this was either poor packing or damaged when manufactured. That said it works great now that is installed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Quality is great, strong, holds at least 3 dozen 14oz cans
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because we have almost NO pantry space and with a family of 4 it's a necessary evil! Quality is great, strong, holds at least 3 dozen 14oz cans. I do wish there was a way to attach more than one unit together and have a track in between. If they could do that, that would be outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Anna C.

customer_reviews.title: Center row not FIFO
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed the pattern the cans follow as they drop prevents the center row from dropping at all, therefore making the center row basically useless. In order to keep with the FIFO one will need to use all the top row and center row before refilling it so the center row will be used at all or manually removing the center row and rearranging. This is not a problem for me but is disappointed as I can't just refill whenever I wish.
customer_reviews.author: Charlynn Gimenez

customer_reviews.title: Love the item
customer_reviews.text: Love the item!!! Easy to put together and works great. After reading other reviews I was aware of the middle row not rolling until the top row was done. Not a big deal. Such a space saver and it saves my feet from cans falling on them :-)
customer_reviews.author: Denise Barnes

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: It did what it's advertised to do and it makes pantry organization much easier. It's a little flimsy feeling to be honest but it's holding so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ronny Rotten

customer_reviews.title: Cans don't fit.
customer_reviews.text: Half of my cans wouldn't fit. Doesn't fit tuna or the Campbell's soup cans. Baked beans cans didn't fit either. I bought 2 of these hoping to store all my cans but its a waste since half the cans don't even fit.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Peterson

customer_reviews.title: cam storage
customer_reviews.text: not what I had hoped for. Held less cans than if I just stacked them on the shelf. I never have 18 of any one thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for pantry and it has been a lifesaver. It does require a little bit of elbow grease to put together, but if it did not it would be flimsy. As it is, it is very Stout and works well. We plan on buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great in pantry
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of the units in my pantry. I love the way that the oldest can is always used first. Only the price is the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Picard

customer_reviews.title: Does not accommodate 18 or 20 oz cans
customer_reviews.text: A bit difficult to put together. Disappointed in that it does not accommodate 20 oz fruit cans , progreso 18 oz soup cans or 16 oz baked bean cans. Works well on regular sizes cans for soup, fruit, cranberry sauce etc
customer_reviews.author: CANDACE COSTELLO

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expected
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Fit cans perfectly. I ended up returning it because it wasn’t exactly what I wanted. The top and middle row have to be empty before you re stock for the rotation to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great visibility
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy use. The assembly is easy, until you have to do the 1/4 turn to lock the rods in place. But they work perfectly and are a simple easy to use design.
customer_reviews.author: H.K. Pilk

customer_reviews.title: Love this idea
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, I use it in my food storage & it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Judi

customer_reviews.title: Function
customer_reviews.text: The three levels of storage is great, but the middle is blocked from dropping into position by the cans from the bottom level automatically being filled from the cans from the top level. This item might work okay if it were only a two level system. It is a waste of money. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Duffer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome storage
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a life saver when it comes to storage and the fact you can add on in astonishing.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Meany

customer_reviews.title: What an organizational boon!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful addition to my pantry. I have wire shelving and that wasn't an issue at all. There is a diagonal support in the center that holds up the shelf above, but I put two sets of can trackers together without joining them. I left a gap where the support bar is and I was still able to use the space between without the pegs to run cans in the lower two shelves. I can see what I have now and it will be so helpful to see at a glance what I need to stock up on. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Warmerdam

customer_reviews.title: Great for food storage and not wasting food in general
customer_reviews.text: Great for food storage and not wasting food in general. They can be a bit of a pain to put together and take apart, but a good wrench can fix that issue.
customer_reviews.author: mwh

customer_reviews.title: Aid to organize pantry. The center section does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Aid to organize pantry. The center section does not roll down unless the top is empty. It is a bit bulky and only accommodates two can sizes. The sizes pictured is what you get so if you want more small can storage is won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Wasnt able to complete putting it together and use it.
customer_reviews.text: I like tge way it should have looked once i finished putting it together. However, i was never able to comple that because its either missing pieces or tge instruction doesn't make sense with the 3 small rods. I want to return the item and get a different can tracker storage. So it sitting on my table not able to be used. Also it didnt seem new box tge box was in bad condtion when i picked it up.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Organize your pantry
customer_reviews.text: Love this to organize my pantry better. I wish each level in the row could be its own and I could put multiple different cans in there, but it all flows down to the bottom row. Still great, and holds my staple canned goods.
customer_reviews.author: Jacinda Bowman

customer_reviews.title: It would be better (for me) if the shelves didn't have a FIFO ...
customer_reviews.text: I can only fit standard size (circumference) cans in this organizer. It would be better (for me) if the shelves didn't have a FIFO feature as I rarely have 12 cans of the same product, so I find myself mixing veggies, fruit and soup on each vertical - and then sifting through the bottom most one to find what I need. Kind of a pain. I'm sure if you had 12 of the same kind of canned good, this would be great. But don't try and store 16 or 20 oz cans in it - you'll just get frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: afreiwald

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty easy to assemble and the sturdiness is ok. My issue is the cans do not roll down like they should and end up getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assembly, and does exactly what I need it to.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. In fact so much that I'm needing another one to finish organizing my cupboard space. Once I have them both I'll post pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how big it it and very sturdy.. love it.. I bought 4 and they can connect together
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Mathis

customer_reviews.title: I like the can holder but it only fits regular sized ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the can holder but it only fits regular sized cans like the corn. It does adjust to a smaller size but not to a larger size to accommodate the bigger cans of kidney or fava beans. For the smaller cans it doesn't adjust a tad bit to fit tomato paste, only the small cans of tomato sauce. I was a little bit disappointed. Wish they would come up with a way to make it adjust to the customer's needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nelia Barros

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT work with Progresso Soup cans
customer_reviews.text: This product is usable for small cans like Campbell's soup, duel monte vegetables, etc. However be forewarned it will NOT with cans like Progresso soup which are only 19 ozs but are too wide. I would recommend that the manufacturer put on the product description the diameter of cans that it will work with. Until then I will make mention to alert anyone considering this unit that it will work fine with cans less than 3" in diameter. Any cans larger than that in diameter will not work. Thus the reason I give it a 2 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Expo67

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the few that I ordered. They hold the cans as described and fit most average cans. If your looking for something that will fit the costco style canned meat this won't work, same goes with most tuna cans. I can say these are very sturdy and I do like them, just wish there was some more 'adjust-ability.'
customer_reviews.author: Keibbler

customer_reviews.title: It's alright, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to put together and works just fine. The only issue is that it only works if you are trying to store considerable quantities of the the SAME type of products. If you have multiple variations, then it is very limiting and requires significant effort to extricate a can amongst the various products and replace those that were removed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Good idea made a little heavier wood be nice.cans stick with over half full
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL RICHMOND

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the purchase! Came a day early, was easy to put together and was sturdy enough to handle all the cans I have.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Lee Hamel

customer_reviews.title: It is very well made and was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: THIS CAN TRACKER FITS PERFECTLY IN MY CABINETS. It is very well made and was easy to assemble. We attached the last piece while the other two sections were in the cabinet. Meaning we did not put it all together then try to fit it into the cabinet space. i AM VERY HAPPY WITH THIS SPACE SAVER.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Pogue

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: These FIFO can trackers are a good option for organizing your pantry. They attach to each other giving you an extra can slot. They're obviously pretty heavy when full so if you plan to daisy chain a bunch of these make sure your shelves can handle the extra weight. Channel locks help with assembly but it can be done without.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality, Love the functionality
customer_reviews.text: Where has this thing been all my life. Sturdy construction. Easy to put together. Fits in my pantry perfectly. Cans feed smoothly and they are easy to access. And it even give you flexible can options.. I will buy this item again
customer_reviews.author: LB12

customer_reviews.title: It works for purpose. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.text: It went together easy. It stores the cans as advertised. I will be buying another. My only suggestion would be to offer one a little wider that would store just the larger 15 oz cans.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Ordered twice
customer_reviews.text: Well built, easy to assemble, good looking. I first ordered 2 units and liked the loom so much that I have ordered 2 more. Pictures is my first order (hooked together).
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A great and easy way to rotate your canned goods. Sturdy. Pleased with this purchase. Will purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much I bought a second within a few days.
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant but it saved me so much space and was easy to put together. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: this is the perfect solution. I love that you can make it ...
customer_reviews.text: HOLDS A TON of cans. If you keep a ton of the same type, this is the perfect solution. I love that you can make it different sizes. Fits good in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Mitchell Kerrr

customer_reviews.title: excellent for storage very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money stores cans neatly and effectively as advertised
customer_reviews.author: James S. TN.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy junk
customer_reviews.text: Two of the sections it came with were cracked and cans get hung up but it's still much better than what we had which was a mess of cans
customer_reviews.author: Kvrazel

customer_reviews.title: Organize NOW
customer_reviews.text: Great at organizing those cans that are scattered throughout your cabinet
customer_reviews.author: edward akelaitis

customer_reviews.title: Can dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Hard to assemble but pleased with the end result. It works well and seems real sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: CWan

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be assembled without reworking the pieces
customer_reviews.text: The pieces did not fit. I had to shave the posts down at the end with a utility knife or they were too large to be inserted into the holes for assembly. This organizer was impossible to assemble without reworking the pieces. It took me 2 hours to modify the pieces so the organizer could be assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Big bulky takes up a lot of space great idea but it would be nice to have more ...
customer_reviews.text: Big bulky takes up a lot of space great idea but it would be nice to have more of different spacers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Well I got two ans one came broken not a huge fan of spending so much and it being broken
customer_reviews.author: LMM

customer_reviews.title: Probably will buy another set
customer_reviews.text: Only downside it won’t hold cans like Campbell’s Chunky Soup
customer_reviews.author: SJWILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Work great for organization
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for was we needed. We recieved on of them that was broken, but we were able to return and get a new one easily. They work smoothly to guide the cans and fit a good amount of sizes too. Our pantry is getting more organized by each organization purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TheHoskins12

customer_reviews.title: Shelf organizer
customer_reviews.text: Great to organize pantry shelve. Wish they had a size for larger cans.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: NOT A REAL FIFO RACK!!!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is NOT a first in, first out rack. The cans on the middle tier WILL NOT be dispensed until the row is nearly empty, meaning new cans will be used before older cans. Also, it’s pretty flimsy. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Rho

customer_reviews.title: They work for me, but my hands are bloodied up!
customer_reviews.text: The items I received did not have finished edges, and trying to get my hands inside to twist the dowels to the locked position resulted in sore fingers and scraped hands. Aside from a very painful assembly, they work. In hindsight, I should have worn work gloves. But, that would have further limited the space for my hands.
customer_reviews.author: My3Sons

customer_reviews.title: Large
customer_reviews.text: Took up a lot of space and small cans take one row
customer_reviews.author: Laura Harris

customer_reviews.title: Shelf space!
customer_reviews.text: I loved how I was able to save SO much shelf space from CANS... so many CANS. now they fit nicely in this thing. Only downside is you have to keep pulling out cans till you get to the can you want. But that’s ok
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great organization
customer_reviews.text: I love these, I was able to organize all my cans on one shelf instead of the 2 I had to use before. Very easy to assemble and sturdy, they are wonderful and I’m so happy I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Food storage and organization made simple!
customer_reviews.text: We like to keep two to three weeks of food on hand but the best way to store it has always been a challenge. These racks keep the cans neatly in place and easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: schmi1

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but one wrong product sent
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered the product I received a 10 can holder vs the 18 can holder. Will be returning the small amount. Overall the product puts together easy, as long you push the compartments together when twisting the connecting rod.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Owen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality if way below what was expected. Fits most soup cans, but won't work with Dole Pineapple cans. Very cheap construction. Unfortunately it's costing us $14 in shipping to return it. Kind of an expensive mistake. If only folks who manufacture stuff like this actually used it, maybe they would manufacture a quality product. I think they spent more money printing the box it was packaged in rather than spending it on the actual product. Sorry to be so negative, but I just dislike companies that manufacture cheap junk and make it sound like it's the "gift to mankind" and will solve all my pantry problems.
customer_reviews.author: CMI

customer_reviews.title: Not a FIFO storage unit.
customer_reviews.text: Not a true FIFO rotation due to middle row. The middle row won't go down til the top row is empty. Also, make sure you measure your cabinet space to make sure it fits before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Love this product I have 3 now. Now i can see what i have and what i need.
customer_reviews.author: adriane Lyons

customer_reviews.title: A Little difficult to put together
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. Had to have help to put it together. Going to order another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Design
customer_reviews.text: This can storage device is excellent for staying organized. It holds plenty of cans and is very sturdy. It only took about 5 minutes and a wrench to put together.
customer_reviews.author: April Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but better
customer_reviews.text: The middle doesn't fall into the rotation if the top still has any in it. While I don't feel like I gained much space it at least looks better
customer_reviews.author: Abigail E.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble but great once you do.
customer_reviews.text: It is a little hard to get together but has improved the efficiency of my pantry by a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: 1 day delivery, super easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and put it together, and Im back to order 2 more. These things are awesome! Helpful assembly tip: Lay it on it's side to assemble it, its easier the line up the dowels that way.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great storage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, holds a lot of cans, works great
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. BC

product_meta.title: FIFO Can Tracker | Stores 54 cans | Rotates First in First Out | Canned Goods Organizer for Cupboard, Pantry and Cabinet | Food Storage | Organize Your Kitchen | Made in USA
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe FIFO first in first out Can Tracker system guarantees you'll never have to deal with can expiration dates again by rotating your food from oldest to newest. Its easy-fit-design also lets you store a variety of can sizes, from small tomato sauce cans to larger vegetable cans. The Can Tracker can hold up to 54 soup-size cans or 45 regular-size cans. The Can Tracker has two can rotation levels. When the top row has finished rotating, the middle track will begin to rotate through. This is great if you are looking to add an organizer to your pantry or cabinet for organizing soup or vegetable cans.
feature_bullets: ORGANIZE YOUR FOOD PANTRY - Our patent designed FIFO Can Tracker keeps your kitchen organized by storing and rotating your canned goods on a First In First Out model saving you from expired food cost and waste! Designed to store cans from 4 to 15 ounces. Perfect for diced chili cans, soup cans or standard vegetable cans. Holds up to 54 cans. Perfect to organize your food storage.
STURDY DESIGN - Made in the USA, this product is built to last and will be a permanent solution to your kitchen organization problem. Easily connect multiple units together to expand your storage.
EASY INSTALLATION - Put together in just minutes following a simple 4 step process.
FITS ON EXISTING SHELVES - Product dimensions are 12" H x 16" W x 16" D allowing you to organize your pantry, cabinet and cupboard.
100% CUSTOMER SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - If you are not satisfied with your purchase and feel this product has not solved your pantry organization problem simply return for a full refund.

specifications.Size: 12 in. high x 16 in. wide x 16 in. long
